subject: RE: [junit] Get JUnit to fail in 'child' thread
msgSnippet: This topic comes up every 3 months on this list. In fact, I would propose that it be listed on the FAQ!  Mike Clark, are you out there listening? Anyhow,
messageBody:
This topic comes up every 3 months on this list.
In fact, I would propose that it be listed on
the FAQ! Mike Clark, are you out there listening?

Anyhow, there's not really any better way than
what you described. It all boils down to the fact
that JUnit relies on Java's exception mechanism for
test methods to report failure. And the run() method
of a Thread never throws.


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of stixwix00
> Sent: Wednesday, November 09, 2005 1:59 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Get JUnit to fail in 'child' thread
>
> Hi,
>
> Does anyone know of an elegant way to get a JUnit test to
> fail when it throws an assertTrue() exception in a separate thread?
>
> So the code might be:
>
> public class MyTest extends TestCase{
>
> class Worker extends Thread {
> public void run(){
> assertTrue(false);
> }
> }
>
> public void testMain() {
> Worker w = new Worker();
> w.start();
> }
>
> When you run the above test, JUnit thinks the test passed.
> I know I could have a boolean at the outer class level, set
> it when I get a failure in the thread, and then assertTrue()
> on this in
> testMain() after joining thread w, but there must be a better way!
>
> Thanks.
> Andy
